title: GetTrendData
description: Retrieves trend data for one or many sources. For many sources with large time intervals, consider splitting requests into smaller chunks to avoid timeouts.

sources.description: A list of GQL paths or DBIDs to resolve as trend sources.

startTime.description: Specifies the starting time boundary for trend data retrieval in milliseconds since the epoch. Numbers < 0 are treated as offsets from the current time.

endTime.description: Specifies the ending time boundary for trend data retrieval in milliseconds since the epoch. Numbers <= 0 are treated as offsets from the current time.

resolution.description: Approximately specifies the resolution for trend data retrieval in milliseconds.

fieldAccess.description: If true, information may be retrieved from devices in the field. It is suggested to leave this false unless you need it.

contextDBID.description: GQL paths in the `sources` property will be resolved relative to this node. If omitted, paths will be resolved relative to the root of the geo tree.
